intro: Strophanthus caudatus f. undulatus, commonly known as the wavy-stemmed strophanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, undulating stems and clusters of yellow or orange flowers. The plant belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap and showy blooms. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often with a hairy texture. The plant is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical uses in traditional medicine.
